description: When you save your tax return in TurboTax Canada 2017, the TT17 file is created to save your progress. It is the main file type used by TurboTax Canada and is primarily utilized for three purposes:

Tax return file extensions used by TurboTax Canada reflect the year of the tax data they contain. Tax returns for the 2016 year use the .TT16 extension, returns for the 2015 year use the .TT15 extension, and so on.
NOTE: The U.S. version of TurboTax 2017 saves files with a .TAX2017 file extension.
